channel.title: Websdr on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Websdr on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: Listening to Radio Havana Cuba via shortwave
item.description: Radio Havana Cuba was one of my cold war era shortwave radio presets. I don't have a working shortwave radio of my own any more, and the miracle of the Internet means that you can now tune in broadcasts directly from the broadcaster without the inconvenience of shortwave tuning. The best way really to listen to a station like R Havana Cuba is via shortwave. Here are a couple of ways that you can do that.

item.title: Some notes on Echolink and websdr
item.description: Echolink is a system that lets amateur radio operators transmit from their computer, through a relay at a suitable Echolink server. You have to be a licensed ham to get on the network, and typically there's a two-way repeater set up to some radio station so that you can hear what's being said on RF and vice versa. websdr is a system that lets anyone listen to a slice of radio spectrum.
